title: Indian Penal Code - Section 302
content:
Punishment for Murder.
        Whoever commits murder shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a 
        term which may extend to life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend 
        to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine, or to both. Exception: Death by accident 
        during lawful act is not murder.

title: Indian Penal Code - Section 420
content:
Cheating and Dishonestly Inducing Delivery of Property.
        Whoever cheats and thereby dishonestly induces the person deceived to deliver any 
        property to any person, or to make, alter or destroy the whole or any part of a valuable 
        security, or anything which is signed or sealed, with the intent that it may be used as 
        a valuable security, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term 
        which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Indian Penal Code - Section 354
content:
Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Outrage Modesty.
        Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending to outrage or knowing 
        it to be likely that he will thereby outrage the modesty of that person, shall be punished 
        with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine which may extend to two 
        thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Indian Penal Code - Section 376
content:
Punishment for Rape.
        Whoever commits rape shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a 
        term which shall not be less than seven years but which may be for life, and shall also 
        be liable to fine. Rape may be committed even without penetration if there is physical 
        contact with sexual intent.

title: Indian Penal Code - Section 498A
content:
Cruelty by Husband or His Relative.
        Whoever, being the husband or the relative of the husband of a woman, subjects such woman 
        to cruelty shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years 
        and shall also be liable to fine which may extend to one thousand rupees.

title: Criminal Procedure Code - Section 154
content:
Registration of First Information Report (FIR).
        (1) Any person can lodge a First Information Report at the nearest police station regarding 
        any cognizable offence.
        (2) The FIR must contain the basic facts and details of the alleged crime.
        (3) If police refuse to register FIR, the person can approach the Magistrate under Section 156(3).

title: Criminal Procedure Code - Section 161
content:
Examination of Witnesses by Police.
        Any police officer not below the rank of Sub-Inspector may examine any person supposed to 
        be acquainted with the facts and circumstances of the case. The examination shall be conducted 
        with due regard to the provisions of this Code and the Indian Evidence Act.

title: Criminal Procedure Code - Section 164
content:
Recording of Confessions and Statements.
        When any person accused of an offence is arrested on a charge of committing an offence of 
        the description mentioned in sub-section (3), the police shall inform the person that he may 
        make a statement to a Magistrate. Any statement made to a Magistrate under this section 
        shall be recorded and shall not be used as evidence against the maker.

title: Criminal Procedure Code - Section 498
content:
Bail in Cognizable Cases.
        In cases where bail is permissible, the police may release the accused on bail before or 
        after the lodging of FIR, without the permission of the Magistrate, on executing a bond.

title: Indian Contract Act - Section 1
content:
Definition of Contract.
        An agreement enforceable by law is a contract. Agreement is made from offer and acceptance. 
        Agreement must be capable of being enforced by law to be a contract.

title: Indian Contract Act - Section 12
content:
Capacity to Contract.
        Every person is competent to contract who is of the age of majority by the law to which he is 
        subject, and who is of sound mind, and is not disqualified from contracting by any law which 
        he is subject to.

title: Indian Contract Act - Section 65
content:
Obligation of Bailee when Goods are Bailed for Repair or Improvement.
        When goods are bailed for repair or improvement, the bailee must restore the goods in good 
        condition within the time stipulated.

title: Code of Civil Procedure - Section 2
content:
Definitions in Code of Civil Procedure.
        (a) Appeal means an application to a Court of appeal by an appellant against a decree passed by 
        a court subordinate to it.
        (b) Appellant means a party who appeals from a decree.
        (c) Defendant means any person sued or proceeded against in a court of law.

title: Code of Civil Procedure - Section 8
content:
Jurisdiction of Courts.
        The jurisdiction of courts shall be determined by: (a) the territory within their jurisdiction, 
        (b) the subject matter of the suit, (c) the value of the suit.

title: Indian Evidence Act - Section 3
content:
Application of Code to all Judicial Proceedings.
        The provisions of this Act shall apply to all judicial proceedings in or before any Court, 
        including Courts Martial, other than proceedings before Parliament.

title: Indian Evidence Act - Section 10
content:
Evidence of Facts Forming Part of Res Gestae.
        Evidence of facts forming part of the same transaction is relevant whether the transaction is 
        one in issue or not.

title: Constitution of India - Article 21
content:
Protection of Life and Personal Liberty.
        No person shall be deprived of his life or personal liberty except according to procedure 
        established by law. This article has been interpreted broadly to include right to privacy, 
        right to health, right to education.

title: Constitution of India - Article 14
content:
Equality Before Law.
        The State shall not deny to any person equality before the law or the equal protection of the 
        laws within the territory of India.

title: Information Technology Act - Section 66
content:
Computer-related Offences: Hacking.
        Whoever, with the intent to cause or knowing that he is likely to cause wrongful loss or damage 
        to the public or any person, by destroying or deleting or altering any information residing in 
        a computer shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 years and/or fine up to 5 lakh rupees.

title: Information Technology Act - Section 79
content:
Exemption from Liability.
        An intermediary shall not be liable for any third-party information, data, or communication link 
        made available or hosted by the intermediary if the intermediary has exercised due diligence.

title: Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita - Section 101
content:
Punishment for Murder.
        Whoever commits murder shall be punished with life imprisonment or imprisonment up to 
        twenty years. This is part of new criminal code replacing IPC Section 302.

title: Industrial Disputes Act - Section 11
content:
Submission of Disputes to Conciliation.
        When a dispute has been referred or has deemed to have been referred to the Government, and 
        unless or until the dispute has been settled, the Government shall follow prescribed procedures.

title: Transfer of Property Act - Section 5
content:
Transfer of Property.
        An act by which a living person conveys property, in present, past or future, to one or more other 
        living persons, or to himself and one or more other living persons, is called a transfer of property.
